channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fishing tents in place overnight which I can see from your notice is illegal., 1st October
item.description:
Tents along edge of Danson lake overnight and there for days on end. They are using the area for their toileting which is potentially a health issue to children and pets. Fisherman have blocked the access areas to lake with wide rope type ties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Left barriers and signage from work done 6 months ago, 1st October
item.description:
These barriers and warning signs have been left in the communal space for a number of months now. These were left when one of the brick flower planters were removed. I assumed they were left because they were going to be rebuilt but I guess not. Please can you arrange for their removal? Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fouling, 1st October
item.description:
Fresh dog Fouling outside 152 Brooke Road. Has been spread about by pedestrians and tradesmen. Causing obstruction and health hazard to residents of above address.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Street cleaning - Blue bags left on street

item.title: Recurring refuse overflow for multi occupant house, 1st October
item.description:
Number 46 has been converted into 6 studio flats, however they only have one small refuse bin for all of them. The rubbish is continually overflowing and has attracted foxes and rats. The bin collection are now refusing to take it because of the mess. The house desperately needs a much larger refuse bin or even two. We have tried to contact the landlord and the occupants to resolve this but to no avail. We are concerned for health and safety reasons as it will only get worse. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalberg Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin bags been here for a week, 1st October
item.description:
Hello, I’m from the Union Jack pub and this rubbish has been here for a week now and no one has picked up yet. I guess whoever did this is not aware that they have to pay to leave rubbish outside. Can this be cleaned up please as we’re going to get mice running around. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 225, Union Street, Southwark, London
